summary: I. Charles Mathews is identified as an individual whose payroll records are documented within the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) files. The documents pertaining to Mathews consist of payroll records and related forms from his time with the HSCA. These records include salary adjustments, employment verification requests, and payroll authorizations. The documents indicate that Mathews was a staff member of the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: I. Charles Mathews' significance lies in his association with the HSCA, the committee responsible for reinvestigating the JFK assassination. The payroll records provide insight into the staffing and financial operations of the HSCA during its investigation.
